Articles.Content:
So, with my planing being pretty much completed, my 0.24.2 64-bit save file being properly modded and (mostly) stable, I want to stream and record my mission planning/operations.

I'll be doing this every morning at or around 5am PST/8am EST for 2 hours or so. This is to get feedback from the KSP community and to document my process along side my ongoing blog. Whether or not anyone watches, I'll be having fun doing this. I'll implement FUSTEK modules once they are updated.

As an aside, this will be my first interplanetary voyage, so expect mishaps. With thast being said, I would love viewer feedback and interjection/help!

LINK: www.justin.tv/thespoonfulofsharpness

This is a fresh save, so I'll be starting from the beginning today. Thanks for watching (if anyone does, that is), and have fun!

EDIT: So apparently FAR is not playing well with either RT2 or another mod. Hopefully I'll have this resolved before tomorrow, but thatks for those of you that stuck it out!

Edited July 30, 2014 by sharpspoonful

Hey there, tomorrow morning I'm going to stream a walkthrough of the parts I want to recreate in .24.2 from my .23.5 save. No real play, but this is to further explain the in-situ set up of our Duna mission and the players involved. expect between 5:00am/5:15 PST showing.

EDIT: GOOOOOOOODMORNING....KERBIN!

So, Ill be testing .24.2 real quick to ensure no more RT2 issues, then I'll be broadcasting. Give me 15 minutes or so.

EDIT#2: My .24.2 is bugged, so ill need to restart a save.

EDIT#3: We are Live!

Edited July 31, 2014 by sharpspoonful
